legacy.name: The Wall Street Journal

legacy.full_text:
WSJ scoop: China ordered officials at central government agencies not to use iPhones and other foreign-branded devices for work or bring them into the office.
https://t.co/IsEUe8O8ze

If WSJ think we are China State-affiliated media, then this article proves they are making fake news. I'm using iPhone to tweet this post.

If they don't think we are state affiliated, please don't call us in that way. 

It's impolite.

legacy.description: Covering media, advertising and the business of pop culture, tweeting about music and comics...hello: brian.steinberg@variety.com
legacy.name: Brian Steinberg

legacy.description: The business of entertainment.
legacy.name: Variety

legacy.full_text:
I'm honored to join the extraordinary team of journalists at @ABC News as Senior White House Correspondent!
This brings an end my international assignments in Beijing, Hong Kong, Tokyo, then back to Beijing. I'll miss all of my brilliant CNN colleagues
https://t.co/iJyrgzbrwZ

Making fake news in China and smear China  has become an elevator for journalists to skyrocket their career. 

What a joke when I hear the ironic word--freedom of press.

legacy.full_text:
In '99, the Philippines beached a ship on Ren'ai Reef in the SCS to assert a claim over the disputed area.

The incoming President Estrada vowed to have the ship towed away.

In '03, Estrada's successor Arroyo reaffirmed the commitment.

But 24 years have passed, the ship remains https://t.co/h1M84XVoBK
